column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////The food was Lettuce Entertain You-quality: inoffensive
column2: surprisingly authentic-tasting in an obviously faux kind of way (Passionfruit sangria? Bitch
column3: please.) and pretty freaking expensive. The people-watching is
column6: especially halfway into that second pitcher of sangria. But if I'm going to eat tapas in Chicago while surrounded by representatives of a much-maligned stereotype of young urban whiteys
column7: I'm going to go to People in Wicker Park
column8: where the much-maligned whiteys are MY PEOPLE and the sangria is stronger AND cheaper.
